Analyze and Visualize Word Proportions Across a Continuous Variable

Source: R/text_mining_functions.R
word_proportion.Rd

This function analyzes and visualizes word proportions across a continuous variable.

Usage

word_proportion(
  dfm_object,
  stm_model,
  continuous_variable,
  selected_terms,
  height = 500,
  width = 900
)

Arguments

dfm_object

A quanteda document-feature matrix (dfm).

stm_model

An STM model object.

continuous_variable

A continuous variable in the metadata.

selected_terms

A vector of terms to analyze trends for.

height

The height of the resulting Plotly plot, in pixels. Defaults to 500.

width

The width of the resulting Plotly plot, in pixels. Defaults to 900.

Value

A list containing Plotly objects and tables with the results.

Details

This function requires a fitted STM model object and a quanteda dfm object. The continuous variable should be a column in the metadata of the dfm object. The selected terms should be a vector of terms to analyze trends for. The required packages are 'htmltools' and 'splines' in addition to the packages loaded by the function.

Examples

if (interactive()) {
  df <- TextAnalysisR::SpecialEduTech
  united_tbl <- TextAnalysisR::unite_text_cols(df, listed_vars = c("title", "keyword", "abstract"))
  tokens <- TextAnalysisR::preprocess_texts(united_tbl, text_field = "united_texts")
  dfm_object <- quanteda::dfm(tokens)
  stm_15 <- TextAnalysisR::stm_15
  word_proportion_results <- TextAnalysisR::word_proportion(
                             dfm_object,
                             stm_model = stm_15,
                             continuous_variable = "year",
                             selected_terms = c("calculator", "computer"),
                             height = 500,
                             width = 900)
  word_proportion_results$plot
  word_proportion_results$table
}
